articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is set to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump and sign a critical minerals deal on Friday as Kyiv works to regain U.S. support to fight off the Russian invasion as Washington reverses its punitive policy towards Moscow.
articles.title: Trump, Zelenskiy to sign minerals deal at White House meeting

articles.author: Lisa Barrington
articles.description: Pilots first heard about a Chinese live-fire naval exercise near Australia last week when already in the air, receiving messages that forced some to change paths through a busy air corridor, satellite text messages to and from pilots seen by Reuters show.
articles.title: Exclusive: Airline pilots surprised by Chinese live-fire warning near Australia, messages show

articles.author: Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: When police told Louis-Marie, 35, that they believed he had been sexually abused two decades earlier by a surgeon who treated him for appendicitis, he thought it was a prank. It wasn't.
articles.title: In French child rape trial, one victim draws inspiration from Gisele Pelicot

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli delegation in Cairo is negotiating to extend the first phase of the Gaza ceasefire when it expires on Saturday rather than move to the second phase as originally planned and as Hamas wants, two Egyptian security sources said on Friday.
articles.title: Israel and Hamas diverge over ceasefire with first phase set to expire

articles.author: Joe Cash, Laurie Chen
articles.description: Beijing said on Friday it opposed President Donald Trump's latest threat to slap an extra 10% duty on Chinese imports, accusing the U.S. of "shifting the blame" on the flow of fentanyl and promising retaliation to protect its interests.
articles.title: China says it opposes latest US tariff threat after Trump sets Tuesday deadline

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Israel is lobbying the United States to keep Syria weak and decentralised, including by letting Russia keep its military bases there to counter Turkey's growing influence in the country, four sources familiar with the efforts said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Israel lobbies US to keep Russian bases in a 'weak' Syria, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva has chosen the head of his Workers Party, Gleisi Hoffmann, to serve as institutional relations minister, the government said in a statement on Friday.
articles.title: Brazil's Lula taps Hoffmann as institutional relations minister

articles.author: Devjyot Ghoshal, Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: Hundreds of foreign nationals pulled out of scam compounds in Myanmar during a crackdown on centres run by criminal gangs have little food, scant healthcare and filthy toilets in the remote militia camp they have been taken to, two detainees said.
articles.title: Some foreigners pulled out of Myanmar scam centres face struggle to get home

articles.author: Pratima Desai, Olena Harmash
articles.description: On snow-covered fields in central Ukraine, where some of the country's biggest proven lithium deposits are located, a small team of ecological consultants drop sensors into holes in the earth to measure water levels.
articles.title: Even after Trump deal, Ukraine faces long uncertain road to mining boom

articles.author: Poppy Mcpherson, Mikhail Flores
articles.description: Four Chinese nationals accused by the Philippines of espionage led Chinese Communist Party-affiliated groups that made donations of cash to a Philippine city and vehicles to two police forces, according to photos, videos and online posts seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Alleged Chinese spies gave Philippine city and police cash and motorbikes
